Election officials in Chatham County: Georgia, did not stop counting votes at 11:05 p.m. as claimed. They processed, tabulated, and reported all the available results at approximately 11:15 p.m.
The claim of: ballots dumped" after counting stopped is not supported by evidence. There was no sudden spike in votes for the Democratic candidates, as shown in a graph accompanying the viral post.
Georgia election official Gabriel Sterli: The board responsible for ballot counting had finished for the evening, while the board responsible for accepting absentee ballots was still processing them.
The decision to pause counting for the e: This decision was deemed normal and not suspicious by election officials.
